crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET HUNTING Telegram API Certificate Observed
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert tls $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any (msg:"ET HUNTING Telegram API Certificate Observed"; flow:established,to_client; tls.cert_subject; content:"CN=api.telegram.org"; fast_pattern; nocase; endswith; classtype:misc-activity; sid:2029322; rev:2; metadata:affected_product Windows_XP_Vista_7_8_10_Server_32_64_Bit, attack_target Client_Endpoint, created_at 2020_01_27, deployment Perimeter, confidence High, signature_severity Minor, updated_at 2020_10_27;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET HUNTING Telegram API Domain in DNS Lookup
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert dns $HOME_NET any -> any any (msg:"ET HUNTING Telegram API Domain in DNS Lookup"; dns.query; content:"api.telegram.org"; nocase; bsize:16; classtype:misc-activity; sid:2033966; rev:1; metadata:attack_target Client_Endpoint, created_at 2021_09_16, deployment Perimeter, performance_impact Low, confidence High, signature_severity Minor, updated_at 2021_09_16;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET HUNTING Observed Telegram API Domain (api .telegram .org in TLS SNI)
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert tls $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET HUNTING Observed Telegram API Domain (api .telegram .org in TLS SNI)"; flow:established,to_server; tls.sni; content:"api.telegram.org"; bsize:16; fast_pattern; classtype:misc-activity; sid:2033967; rev:1; metadata:attack_target Client_Endpoint, created_at 2021_09_16, deployment Perimeter, performance_impact Low, confidence High, signature_severity Informational, updated_at 2021_09_16;)

attributes.magic: Zip archive data, at least v1.0 to extract, compression method=store

threat_severity.level_description: Severity MEDIUM because it was considered trojan.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Script Interpreter Execution From Suspicious Folder
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects a suspicious script execution in temporary folders or folders accessible by environment variables
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Hashes=MD5=04029E121A0CFA5991749937DD22A1D9,SHA256=9F914D42706FE215501044ACD85A32D58AAEF1419D404FDDFA5D3B48F66CCD9F,IMPHASH=7C955A0ABC747F57CCC4324480737EF7; Description=Windows PowerShell; FileVersion=10.0.19041.546 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine="C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\goland-otpbot-api-main/9f5sIpDW.hKY.exe" ; CommandLine=powershell -WindowStyle Hidden -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -Command "try { Compress-Archive -Path 'C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\RavenStealer\*' -DestinationPath 'C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\Bruno_RavenStealer.zip' -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue } catch { }"; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\goland-otpbot-api-main\9f5sIpDW.hKY.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Zip A Folder With PowerShell For Staging In Temp - PowerShell Script
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects PowerShell scripts that make use of the "Compress-Archive" Cmdlet in order to compress folders and files where the output is stored in a potentially suspicious location that is used often by malware for exfiltration.
An adversary might compress data (e.g., sensitive documents) that is collected prior to exfiltration in order to make it portable and minimize the amount of data sent over the network.

match_context.values: @{ScriptBlockText=try { Compress-Archive -Path 'C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\RavenStealer\*' -DestinationPath 'C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\Bruno_RavenStealer.zip' -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue } catch { }; MessageTotal=1; ScriptBlockId=601ac207-249c-427b-94b7-1a3ebf5a8c7e; Path=; MessageNumber=1; EventID=4104}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Folder Compress To Potentially Suspicious Output Via Compress-Archive Cmdlet
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects PowerShell scripts that make use of the "Compress-Archive" Cmdlet in order to compress folders and files where the output is stored in a potentially suspicious location that is used often by malware for exfiltration.
An adversary might compress data (e.g., sensitive documents) that is collected prior to exfiltration in order to make it portable and minimize the amount of data sent over the network.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects execution of "tar.exe" in order to create a compressed file.
Adversaries may abuse various utilities to compress or encrypt data before exfiltration.
